Responsibilities: Improved the functionality of an interactive accessibility map
Optimized zoom-in and sidebar navigation features
Designed and implemented a robust backend system using Python
Built secure and scalable RESTful APIs with Flask/FastAPI
Focused on user privacy and data security by integrating encryption protocols and adaptive learning
Enhanced the LightGBM algorithm with custom loss functions and feature engineering
Developed robust preprocessing methods to clean and manage a sample dataset of 60,000 rows
Designed and fine-tuned an ensemble forecasting system combining SARIMA, LightGBM, and Transformers
Researching and planning backend architecture for a Dynamic Course Recommender app
Investigating machine learning libraries such as sci-kit-learn and TensorFlow to develop personalized course recommendation algorithms
Evaluating web scraping tools like BeautifulSoup and natural language processing libraries for gathering and analyzing course information
Planned and designed an intuitive interface using vanilla JavaScript
Implemented features and interactions to elevate the overall user experience
Led a team of 200 in a startup initiative involving 1000 people during the second wave of COVID-19 in India
Coordinated efforts with contractors to secure oxygen cylinders and essential supplies

Projects.Name: DocuQuery
Details: Developed a lightweight document-based QA tool
Processed and chunked PDFs into over 1,000 context windows using SentenceTransformers
Delivered real-time answers through a local Streamlit UI

Projects.Name: Resumagic
Details: Built a client-side AI tool leveraging Gemini API and PDF.js to convert resumes into responsive portfolio websites
Integrated AWS Lambda for secure Gemini API interactions
Deployed the frontend via Amazon S3 and CloudFront

Projects.Name: Findr by OpuLnt
Details: Collaborated with a team of four to develop a lost-and-found app for ASU students
Designed secure systems for interactive item listings and direct messaging

Projects.Name: EventFinder
Details: Developed an iOS app that allows users to search for events
Integrated with Ticketmaster Discovery API to fetch event data
Utilized CoreLocation to display event locations on the map view

Projects.Name: ThriveSpace
Details: Developed a full-stack web app focused on mental well-being
Designed secure systems to ensure robust data privacy

Projects.Name: Hacks for Humanity
Details: Led the implementation of a website feature featuring an OTP password generator login system
Orchestrated the complete back-end development for the full-stack project
Played a key role in constructing specific sections of the database

questions.question: During your internship at WheelEasy Foundation, you improved the functionality of an interactive accessibility map. Imagine a user reports a critical bug affecting the zoom functionality on specific mobile devices. How would you approach prioritizing and addressing this issue?
options: Immediately fix the bug, pushing a hotfix directly to production to minimize user disruption.
Gather more information from the user, including device details and steps to reproduce the error, before prioritizing the fix.
Investigate the bug's root cause, assess its impact on other functionalities, and then schedule a fix based on its severity and overall project priorities.
Delegate the bug fix to another team member who specializes in mobile development.

questions.question: While leading ParmarthNGO's COVID-19 initiative, you faced the challenge of securing essential supplies amidst a crisis.  Imagine a key supplier suddenly becomes unavailable. How would you adapt your strategy to ensure the continued delivery of these critical resources?
options: Immediately contact alternative suppliers, even if it means paying a premium, to ensure an uninterrupted supply chain.
Ration existing supplies while simultaneously exploring multiple alternative sourcing options, considering factors like cost, reliability, and delivery time.
Focus on communicating the supply chain disruption to the affected community and seek their assistance in finding alternative solutions.
Temporarily halt the distribution of supplies until a reliable supplier can be secured to avoid potential logistical complications.

questions.question: In the Findr by OpuLnt project, you designed secure systems for a lost-and-found app. Imagine a user reports a potential security vulnerability that could expose user data.  How would you approach this situation?
options: Publicly acknowledge the vulnerability and assure users that a fix is underway to maintain transparency.
Immediately take the app offline to prevent further exploitation while investigating and patching the vulnerability.
Discreetly investigate the reported vulnerability, validate its authenticity, and develop a fix before notifying users or taking the app offline.
Contact the user directly to gather more information about the vulnerability before taking any action.

questions.question: Reflecting on your experience developing ThriveSpace, you focused on ensuring robust data privacy for users dealing with sensitive mental health information.  If a new regulation regarding data storage were introduced, how would you approach updating the app to comply?
options: Implement the minimum required changes to comply with the new regulation while minimizing impact on existing features.
Thoroughly review the new regulation, assess its impact on the app's architecture, and plan a comprehensive update strategy to ensure full compliance.
Delay implementing changes until the new regulation's impact becomes clearer and best practices emerge within the industry.
Consult with legal experts to interpret the regulation and determine the most cost-effective approach to compliance.

questions.question: During the Hacks for Humanity project, you led the implementation of a new login system.  Imagine the team disagreed on the best approach for password recovery. How would you navigate this conflict to reach a solution?
options: Implement the most secure approach, regardless of the team's preferences, to prioritize user safety.
Facilitate a discussion to understand each team member's perspective and explore the pros and cons of each proposed approach before making a decision.
Defer to the team's majority opinion to avoid further conflict and ensure timely project completion.
Research industry best practices for password recovery and present them to the team to guide the decision-making process.
